thread.title: Hi-tech multibillion-dollar warplanes arrive in Australia - 9news.com.au
thread.title_full: Hi-tech multibillion-dollar warplanes arrive in Australia - 9news.com.au

author: Richard Wood
title: Hi-tech multibillion-dollar warplanes arrive in Australia - 9news.com.au
text:
Hi-tech multibillion-dollar warplanes arrive in Australia By Richard Wood 
Two of the most advanced and costly military aircraft in the world today are making their first appearance in Australia. 
The Lockheed-Martin F-35 Lightning II Joint Strike Fighter and the Boeing EA-18G Growler Electronic Attack aircraft are appearing at Airshow Australia in Avalon, Victoria, on Friday where they will be flown by pilots from the RAAF. 
Both aircraft represent a multibillion and controversial investment by the federal government. 
Spending on the F-35 programme by Australia, which is buying 72 planes, has totalled $17b but has been beset by technical problems, an overrun in costs and claims it is lacking in air combat capability against Chinese and Russian aircraft. 
Last month US President Donald Trump criticised the mounting costs paid by American taxpayers that were involved in developing the F-35. The Lockheed-Martin F-35 Joint Strike Fighter. (Getty). 
But these setbacks have not stopped the Australian Government from talking up the arrival of the jets. 
"Together, the F-35A Joint Strike Fighter and the EA-18G Growler represent a potent and technologically advanced air combat and strike capability that is essential to our ability to defend Australia and our national interests," said Defence Minister Marise Payne at a defence industry event in Canberra last week. 
Senator Payne also noted that Australia is the only country outside the US to operate the Growler, which "represents a significant leap forward in our capability, introducing a dedicated electronic attack capability for the first time." 
Australia is buying 12 Growlers at a cost of about $3.7b due to be delivered to RAAF Base Amberley this year. 
The jets carry numerous electronic jamming systems as well as missiles that can destroy enemy radar and communication systems. The Boeing EA-18A Growler is a hi-tech electronic attack aircraft. RAAF. Â© Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
